name: Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights at this excellent hotel. The room was spotless, comfortable and enormous (bigger than many 5 star hotels), including small kitchen area with microwave, kettle etc. Very comfortable bed, and a more than adequate bathroom (with heated floor!). The staff are friendly, courteous, helpful and a credit to the owners. This is not a full service hotel, so there is no restaurant but snacks are available at the small bar during the day and evening. However, the breakfast room is of a very high standard and a buffet breakfast at 18 euros has a wide choice of meats, pastries, cereals and fresh fruits as well as scrambled egg, bacon, sausage and more. The location is good, quietly situated, close to Checkpoint Charlie and to the U-Bahn so quick and easy access to anywhere in the city. Unter den Linden is about 15 minutes easy walk. Travel round the city is cheap with an all day group ticket for up to 5 people being especially good value. The room rate for this quality of accommodation was outstanding value at 112 Euros per night pre-paid for an "Executive" suite.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The Mecure Hotel and Residenz is a terrific hotel to stay at while traveling in Berlin. I stayed there for two nights with my parents and brother and couldn't have been happier. As there were four of us we stayed in the Deluxe Suite. The Deluxe Suite was well beyond our expectations. It had two full bedrooms, a half bath, and a shower room. This was an ideal set up.
reviews.title: A Great Find!

likes.liked: — I liked the set up of our hotel room the best!
likes.disliked: — The door to our bathroom was hard to shut and lock - as it was a new buidling.

reviews.text: The hotel reception was very friendly and assited us with transportation and travel details. There were also always apples and iced tea availabe for the guests.
reviews.title: Clean, cheerful, convenient

reviews.text: The location of the hotel was excellent. It was located about a two minute walk from Checkpoint Charlie. Gendarenmarkt was only about a 5 minute walk away.
reviews.title: great hotel, even better than expected

reviews.text: We did not partake in the hotel breakfast as it was 18 euros a person. There were a dozen backerei near the hotel which we used for breakfast and I would definitely recommend this option.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location and Lovely Staff

reviews.text: This hotel has so many positive reviews I saw little choice but to stay here. Especially given the excellent price. But I will say it was more three star in areas than the four they showed on their door.
reviews.title: Excellent value

likes.liked: — Staff, room and location. Basically the three most important things.

reviews.text: The staff were overly friendly professional. Up there with the best I have seen in Europe. They speak very good English also.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Ideal Location

reviews.text: The room was more like a suite so maybe we got lucky. It had a separate living area and a huge bedroom. Off the living area was an external balcony looking down into the court yard. The funriture though, a blend of Orange carpet, yellow curtains and vivid blue suede chairs did cheapen the look with a feel more like a motel. But fittings including the bathroom with separate bath and shower were quality.
reviews.title: Big rooms, good location

reviews.text: Location wise this is brillant. It is walking distance to everything and only a 25 minute cab to the airport for about €25.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel, terrific value

reviews.text: I didn't try the breakfast because you are surrounded by cafes. A lot of chain type stuff but a decent coffee at least.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, within walking distance of all central attractions. Check out the French "steak and chips" restaurant 50m away, and the high class (expensive) cocktail/champagne bar just up the road. Hotel is good, clean, rooms large, quiet and well equipped. Breakfast is OK (only). Perhaps slightly expensive, certainly no bargain (hence the 4* rating here) - would recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good rooms, slightly corporate

reviews.text: Recenty stayed here to attend a conference at the ICC in Berlin. Hotel is a nice clean 4 star hotel. Very close to Checkpoint Charlie (about 3 blocks away). We booked the cheapest room available and got upgraded to a large room on arrival. Downside was that the room was on the 8th floor and the elevator only goes to the 7th floor. Not a big deal on a daily basis except for the luggage. The rooftop room was quite nice although it had some quirks (which are to be expected in older buildings). For example, the toilet and shower were located in separate bathrooms.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Berlin

likes.liked: — Price was very low for a 4 star hotel in Europe.
likes.disliked: — Internet was expensive at 30 euros per day.

reviews.text: Staff was very nice. Service was great. For example, we left the do not disturb sign on our door while out sightseeing one day and when we can back, a bag full of clean towels was left on the door knob. Free apples are available at the front desk and Tuesdays are free massage days (register at the front desk for a free 15 minute massage).
reviews.title: Loved it and would definitely go back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps the only downside was lack of a coffee maker in the room.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.text: Stayed for a whole week, and can't complain at all. Location's great, close to subway station, shopping area, easy walking distance to excellent restaurants, etc. Some might consider it being away from all the "main areas" but that is NOT TRUE. It is so excellently located, there is really nothing to complain about. Great buffet in the morning, nice staff, wonderful patio out in the back...would definitely recommend it to everyone!!!
reviews.title: We LOVED it!

reviews.text: For a first visit to Berlin, this hotel was the perfect choice. It is in a great location - very close to Checkpoint Charlie and walking distance to many of the main tourist sites, with underground stations just yards away. It is located on a quiet street, but not too far from the hustle and bustle of historic Berlin. We had booked two deluxe suites and they were lovely. Very spacious, clean, modern with great aircon - just as well because Berlin was very hot during our stay. The hotel bar was friendly and welcoming and the staff were extremely helpful, courteous and spoke extremely good English, Overall, a delightful stay in a great hotel in a wonderful city.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: The hotel was excellent, great and large rooms, very quiet hotel. Very good breakfast. Staff was friendly and very helpfull with booking of an evening out.
reviews.title: Great service, very friendly staff

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to evrybody. Very good price/value. MAny siteseeing locations on walkingdistance
reviews.title: The Friendly Mercure

likes.liked: — Friendliness of staff, quality of room

reviews.title: Great place from which to explore Berlin.
reviews.text: My wife and I and son stayed in what can only be described as a suite. The room was excellent in terms of facilities, size etc. We were very impressed with the staff who helped us in many ways including giving us directions to Union Berlin FC!! Overall we felt the hotel more than lived up to its 4 star status. We will be back in December. The location is convenient to many of the sights with Stadmitte Ubanhof very close.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked through Venere,com. Quiet but central location,large comfortable room, pleasant courtyard, helpful staff and good restaurants within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel at Great Location

likes.disliked: — Vodaphone's poor pay internet service which was very flaky.

reviews.text: My friend & I stayed in this hotel on a room only basis in April this year. The hotel is very central & a great location. As the name suggests it is very close to check point charlie but you can walk everywhere else.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is clean & rooms are large & spacious. There is a bar downstairs & staff are very curteous & efficient. An excellent hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: It is a great hotel with very helpful staff. We got almost an apartment with two bedrooms for a family of four and very quiet area but still very close to all the tourist spots. No complaint at all.
reviews.title: Huge rooms, flawless service

reviews.text: After a long flight from San Francisco, a missed connection in LHR and a long, long queue to report missing bags at Tegel we finally made it here at about 12:30 a.m.!
reviews.title: Fabulous - no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and the picture of professionalism even at that late hour; the bar stayed open a little longer so we could have a couple of drinks to soothe ourselves. The room itself was enormous. You could have played a game of indoor soccer in it. A nice little lounge area on one side, a massive bathroom where we weren't bumping into each other trying to brush our teeth.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good location

reviews.text: A great hotel in a fantastic location right next to Checkpoint Charlie. I received a free room upgrade to a maisonette on the 5th floor with a balcony overlooking the street - very nice!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Excellent, varied breakfast, extremely pleasant staff and good overall level of service.
reviews.title: probably the friendliest hotel in the world !

reviews.text: One criticism - I was visiting Berlin with work and so needed internet access in my room. Unfortunately the wireless signal was very weak and I kept loosing the connection. Other than that I have nothing but praise for this very comfortable hotel!
reviews.title: Very Clean, Huge Room and Convenient Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to this hotel for 3 nights with 6 other colleagues. Our rooms were super and spacious, with a balcony to the inner courtyard.
reviews.title: Brillliant, brilliant, brilliant. More than lived up to our expectations.

likes.liked: — room quality, staff, free internet access in lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The overwhelming memory of this hotel ( and I travel a lot ) is that the staff , universally , were the friendliest, and most helpful I have ever encountered.
reviews.title: Mercure Berlin Checkpoint Charlie Very Nice

reviews.text: If it all possible, I try to stay at Mercure Checkpoint Charlie when I visit Berlin for business. The hotel offers good value for money, with modern, comfortable rooms and a central location at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Great comfort in the center of Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, well-maintained and modern. The hotel is smack in the middle of town but located in a quiet street. There's a nice garden terrace for hot summer days and the staff are very helpful indeed. The breakfast is up to the usual good Mercure standard.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly attitude

likes.disliked: — Boring architecture compared to others in Berlin, but who cares??

reviews.text: You have two U-Bahn stations within five minutes' walking distance, and the hotel is very close to tourist hot spots like Checkpoint Charlie, Unter den Linden, Gendarmenmarkt, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag and the Museumsinsel.
reviews.title: nice hotel - bad location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a bit business looking but inside both the rooms and the personel are instead quite warm. The small fitness and sauna on the last floor are tiny but very clean and welcoming. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful and would give you the right calory input to start your visit in Berlin starting from CPC j(check Point Charlie) just outside. Nothing special to say about the architecture of the block which was desighned by Aldo Rossi, quite boring yet colorful, seems a bit of a Paris periferic block.
reviews.title: Great base for a city trip.

reviews.text: The director of the hotel is very friendly, helpful and professional.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for a four night stay in Berlin. We had a great experience at the hotel. Our room was much larger than we expected. It was decorated with very cool, funky modern furniture. The bathroom was also very chic and clean. We had zero complaints about the room. The hotel is in a cool area as well. Totally accessible by subway. It's fairly quiet at night but there are a few restaurants around and there's plenty of historial sites to visit during the day. It's also an easy walk to Friedrichstrasse which is very central.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: Our only negative experience with the hotel was partially our own fault. When we checked in we were told where breakfast was and what time it was served every morning. We should have asked how much it cost, but given that the room service prices weren't exhorbitant, we assumed that the breakfast buffet would be priced reasonably as well. We eventually asked and were shocked to find out that breakfast cost €18 per person. Although the breakfast spread was generous, that was WAY more than we would have wanted to spend on breakfast. Live and learn...
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: This is an excellent choice for a family of three that includes a teenager as they allow three adults in a room. Better deal than booking two rooms with a "lower" class hotel in the Accor chain - especially with a summer offer that included (excellent) breakfasts. They gave us a free room upgrade too. Modern clean rooms overlooking an attractive inner courtyard; safe area; helpful, multi-lingual staff. Hotel well situated - brisk walk to many of the sites of Berlin. Easy to get to from Hauptbahnhof by S and U-bahn to Stadtmitte. Eat at Lagano in Kronenstrasse for good, unpretentious Italian food.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the Mercure checkpoint charlie was amazing, we booked an executive suite and the room was huge!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in a Special Location
No place like Mercure Hotel & Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie
reviews.text: it had a dining table for 8 people which seemed a little pointless as there was no cooking facilities but then again we didnt come to berlin to sit in our room all day.

reviews.title: Nice location!
reviews.text: The room and hotel were clean and well-kept. We were given a 10% discount to the Italian place down the street for a late dinner that night as well. The location is absolutely fantastic if you like to walk. It is right down the street from the Stadmitte underground stop, so as long as you don't have 2 tons of luggage, getting there via public transport is no problem. Checkpoint Charlie is literally a stone's throw away, and every other sight like the Reichstag, Museum Island, Wall Memorials, the Brandonburg Gate, etc are all within a 20 minute or so walk from the hotel. There are plenty of good places to eat in the area as well. Highly recommended!
Nice location and very friendly and helpfull staff!But the room was'nt more than average in my opinion-and barly that.Had expected more from a 4 star hotel!!
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hard to add anything. Hotel is superbly located. Rooms are amazing. Staff helpful, a nice touch is apples at reception for anyone to take. There is a sauna on the 7th floor. Would not consider going elsewhere in Berlin (having stayed in many different accommodations and areas).
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a wonderful find! The price, location, and size of room was awesome! It is in a great location, the staff is friendly, easy access to the metro, and spacious rooms!
reviews.title: Very Nice

aka: Mercure Hotel And Residenz Berlin Checkpoint Charlie
description: The Mercure Hotel & Residence Berlin Checkpoint Charlie is located in the historic centre of the town and offers 135 spacious rooms, suites and apartments ( 30m² - 80m² ). Most of them have a balcony. Here you will be living in a particularly exclusive location, right by the former Checkpoint Charlie and near to the shopping stretch of Friedrichstraße and Gendarmenmarkt. Our hotel provides a breakfast restaurant, 1 meeting room, wine garden, Checkpoint Bar, 24 h sauna, gym, sundeck and garage.
